issues.title: Cell border sometimes remains expanded after exiting edit mode (regression from v6.7.0 to v6.20.4)
issues.author: web-delivery
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

https://stackblitz.com/edit/github-mpav2dlm?file=src%2Fdemo.tsx

Steps:
1. Click a cell to enter edit mode (the cell border expands).
2. Enter a value.
3. Click outside the grid to exit edit mode.
4. The cell border is expected to shrink back to the normal non-editing size.
5. However, in version 6.20.4, the border occasionally remains expanded as if still in edit mode.
6. Repeat several times. The issue occurs intermittently (approximately 1 out of 10 times).

### Current behavior

After leaving edit mode, the cell border sometimes does not return to its normal size and remains in the "editing" visual state. This happens intermittently (around 10% of the time).

### Expected behavior

When exiting edit mode, the cell border should always shrink back to the normal size.
This behavior worked correctly in version 6.7.0.

### Context

The issue started after upgrading:
- "@mui/x-data-grid": "^6.7.0"  â†’ "^6.20.4"
- "@mui/x-data-grid-pro": "^6.7.0" â†’ "^6.20.4"

Impact: UI display issue only; data registration is not affected.
Possibly related to grids with row-addition enabled (not fully confirmed).

Support key (Order ID): 118470
Submitted by Tegara Corp. on behalf of our customer in Japan.

### Your environment

MUI X DataGrid Pro version affected: 6.20.4
Previously working version: 6.7.0

**Search keywords**: datagrid, datagrid pro, edit mode, cell border, border not shrinking, layout issue, intermittent, regression, v6.20.4, v6.7.0

**Order ID**: 118470

triage.suggestedAction: Regression from v6.7.0 to v6.20.4 with paid support. Investigate cell border CSS state not clearing on edit mode exit. Check focus/blur event handlers.

issues.title: RichTreeViewPro lazy loading spinners reset when any prop reference changes
issues.author: BrentFarese

triage.suggestedAction: Premium support bug with root cause identified. deriveStateFromParameters resets lazyLoadedItems on every render. Fix: exclude lazyLoadedItems from deriveStateFromParameters.

issues.title: [question] Disabling scrollbars on nested DataGrid in multi-level master-detail
issues.author: marpro200
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

Hi,
I have a master-detail with tree layers. Each layer is again a full DataGrid with lots of columns.
The default behaviour is, that each detail DataGrid has its own horizontal scrollbar. This is really annoying if you expand multiple details and their details. You could end up with different scroll positions on the details.

Our requirement is the following:
- no detail has a scrollbar (no horizontal and no vertical)
- master grid has a horizontal scrollbar
- when expanding a detail that is wider then the current columns of the master grid, the horizontal scrollbar needs to appear
- when a detail is expanded, the horizontal scrollbar of the master grid considers the width of its widest expanded detail

Default behaviour: https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/agitated-goodall-ymgrr6

I managed to hide all scrollbars of the details, but how can I make the scrollbar of the master grid consider its widest detail?

My current state: https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/4mx3xq

### Your environment

Windows 11, Chrome

**Search keywords**: datagrid master-detail scrollbars

**Order ID**: 112488

triage.suggestedAction: Premium support question about master-detail scrollbar behavior. Provide guidance on syncing scroll widths or suggest a CSS workaround.

issues.title: [tree view] Support skeleton UI
issues.author: Janpot
issues.body:
### Summary

Allow labels to be a `React.ReactNode` so I can pass `<Skeleton />` to it and render a beautiful loading state that stays close to the real treeview. Or just a `loading` prop to show skeleton items.

### Examples

_No response_

### Motivation

_No response_

**Search keywords**: RichTreeView loading skeleton

triage.suggestedAction: Feature request for skeleton/loading UI in tree view. Consider adding a loading prop or allowing ReactNode labels.

issues.title: [pickers] Add year range picker
issues.author: caillou
issues.body: ### Summary Similar to the request for [request for month range](https://github.com/mui/mui-x/issues/4995), we need a `` component in our application. ### Examples ### Motivation Our forms express `project year` as either a year or a range, e.g. `2021` or `2021-2025`. For now, we've implemented this, using a mask on top of a `TextField`. Having a UI element for this would be very helpful. **Search keywords**: year range picker **Order ID**: 110649

triage.suggestedAction: Feature request for YearRange picker component. Related to existing month range request #4995. Evaluate feasibility.

issues.title: [question] Vulnerability in minimatch causing npm audit to fail
issues.author: justin-wilxite
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

Hi, sorry if the solution here is obvious but there's a recent security vulnerability in minimatch and it seems like @mui/x-internal-exceljs-fork has a dependency on it

https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3ppc-4f35-3m26

If I use the latest MUI X I get this output from `npm audit fix --force`

```
# npm audit report

minimatch  <10.2.1
Severity: high
minimatch has a ReDoS via repeated wildcards with non-matching literal in pattern - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3ppc-4f35-3m26
fix available via `npm audit fix`
node_modules/archiver-utils/node_modules/minimatch
node_modules/readdir-glob/node_modules/minimatch
  glob  3.0.0 - 10.5.0
  Depends on vulnerable versions of minimatch
  ...
  @mui/x-internal-exceljs-fork  *
  Depends on vulnerable versions of archiver
  ...
  @mui/x-data-grid-premium  >=8.15.0
  Depends on vulnerable versions of @mui/x-internal-exceljs-fork
  ...

8 high severity vulnerabilities
```

**Search keywords**: minimatch

**Order ID**: 122137

triage.suggestedAction: High severity minimatch ReDoS vulnerability via exceljs fork dependency chain. Update archiver/minimatch deps in @mui/x-internal-exceljs-fork.

issues.title: [question] How do you apply maintaining the expanded state of a group when the sort model changes for example?
issues.author: mbiggs-gresham
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

The docs give an example of maintaining the group expansion state here https://mui.com/x/react-data-grid/server-side-data/row-grouping/#row-expansion-state-persistence however this is triggered from a button click. How would you achieve the same when the sort model changes for example?

1. Sort model changes
2. `getRows` is called and new data returned
3. Expanded state is lost

### Your environment

**Search keywords**: datasource row grouping expanded state

**Order ID**: 45466

triage.suggestedAction: Premium support question about persisting group expansion state on sort model change. Point to onSortModelChange callback to restore expanded state.

issues.title: [data grid] Row grouping with a datasource doesn't respect the order the rows are returned
issues.author: mbiggs-gresham
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Steps:
1. Open this link to live example: https://mui.com/x/react-data-grid/server-side-data/row-grouping/#implementating-server-side-row-grouping
2. Expand a few groups in the demo
3. Apply a sort to a column (eg title)
4. The sort is never respected.

### Current behavior

When using a datasource with row grouping, the order in which the rows are returned from the `getRows` is never respected after the first render.

I've tried invalidating the cache, but it never seems to update.

### Expected behavior

Changing the order of the rows from `getRows` should be reflected in the grid.

### Context

I want group grids using a datasource to be updated when I update the sortmodel.

**Search keywords**: datasource row grouping

**Order ID**: 45466

triage.suggestedAction: Bug in server-side row grouping not respecting sort order from getRows. Investigate cache invalidation logic for grouped rows.

issues.title: [charts] Warn users when the controlled tooltip does not match the trigger
issues.author: alexfauquette
issues.body:
If the user is controlling the state then it is an intentional behaviour, it is not about "magic", it is about user intention.

How likely is it that the user will update the state without wanting it to be updated? ðŸ˜†

We could at least warn users if they update the state and it won't have any effect ðŸ¤·

_Originally posted by @JCQuintas in https://github.com/mui/mui-x/pull/21351#discussion_r2822409299_

triage.suggestedAction: Internal discussion about adding a dev warning when controlled tooltip state doesn't match trigger. Low effort improvement.

issues.title: DataGrid CSP Error: Emotion CacheProvider nonce is not used in inline styles
issues.author: visualjerk
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Steps:
1. Clone reproduction repo: https://github.com/visualjerk/mui-x-data-grid-csp
2. Install dependencies: `yarn install`
3. Run and open example: `yarn dev`

### Current behavior

Some styles are not loaded, because of CSP errors.

### Expected behavior

The styles are loaded without CSP errors.

### Context

Workaround: Add the nonce directly to DataGrid: `<DataGrid nonce="N0NCE" />`

**Search keywords**: datagrid, csp, emotion, cacheprovider, inline styles, nonce

**Order ID**: 109756

triage.suggestedAction: DataGrid ignores Emotion CacheProvider nonce for its inline styles. Should propagate nonce from CacheProvider context automatically.

issues.title: ajv has ReDoS when using `$data` option
issues.author: damiangreen
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. add a package with "@mui/x-license": "^8.26.0"
2. pnpm audit --prod

### Current behavior

ajv ReDoS vulnerability (moderate) via @mui/x-license > @mui/x-telemetry > conf > ajv

### Expected behavior

no security vulnerabilities

### Context

Workaround: pnpm override ajv >= 8.18.0

**Search keywords**: ajv has ReDoS when using `$data` option

triage.suggestedAction: Moderate ajv ReDoS vulnerability via x-telemetry > conf > ajv dependency chain. Update conf or override ajv version.

issues.title: [data grid] getRowId prop does not work with server-side tree data
issues.author: ahmedBilal5
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

The server-side tree data grid is having problems when row id is provided through the `getRowId` prop instead of from the data itself.

Steps:
1. Open this link to live example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/wyr8jahq-evdddasn?file=src%2FDemo.tsx
2. Expand a node in the tree.
3. Do either of:
   a. Collapse the same node and expand it again.
   b. Click _Increment the counter_ to re-calculate memoized datasource.

Error: MUI X: The Data Grid component requires all rows to have a unique `id` property.

### Current behavior

Error thrown when using getRowId with server-side tree data.

### Expected behavior

Grid should work same as it does when adding id property to the data itself and removing `getRowId` prop.

**Search keywords**: server-side tree data data-grid-pro

**Order ID**: 123695

triage.suggestedAction: Bug: getRowId prop not respected in server-side tree data. The internal updateRows call doesn't use getRowId to resolve row identity. Needs fix.

issues.title: DataGridPro TreeData: "inside" Drop Not Triggered When Initial Data Contains No Child Nodes
issues.author: Abassion
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open this link to live example: https://codesandbox.io/p/devbox/gallant-cori-m65h6y
2. Drag a file into the "src" folder.

### Current behavior

The file is not reordered as a child inside the "src" folder.

### Expected behavior

The file should be reordered as a child inside the "src" folder.

### Context

The goal is to have an empty file system where the user can create files and folders and be able to reorder them, nest them ...etc.

**Search keywords**: MUI DataGridPro treeData rowReordering inside drop not working

**Order ID**: 116191

triage.suggestedAction: Bug in TreeData row reordering: 'inside' drop zone not triggered when target folder has no existing children. Investigate drop target detection logic.

issues.title: [data grid] Group row at bottom?
issues.author: mbiggs-gresham
issues.body:
### Summary

What would be the possibility of the group grid supporting the group row being at the bottom underneath the expanded child rows? So group row is present, expand it, and it shunts down to underneath the children. This may only make sense for grids with only 1 level deep.

In many financial applications you want the aggregate data for each group to be underneath. A group quite commonly may only contain 2 child rows, so something at the top or bottom of grid doesn't really work. It needs to be part of the group itself.

**Search keywords**: group grid

**Order ID**: 45466

triage.suggestedAction: Feature request: group row at bottom of expanded children (common in financial UIs). Evaluate feasibility for single-level grouping.

issues.title: [docs] Demo TreeDataSyncRowData crashes
issues.author: Abassion
issues.body:
- [x] I have searched for similar issues and believe this is not a duplicate.

## Steps to reproduce
1. Visit https://mui.com/x/react-data-grid/tree-data/
2. Demo TreeDataSyncRowData crashes

## Your environment
| Tech | Version |
|------|--------|
| Version | v8.27.0 |
| Browser | Chrome 144.0.0.0 |

triage.suggestedAction: Documentation demo TreeDataSyncRowData is crashing on the live docs site. Fix the demo code.

issues.title: [charts-pro] GHSA-w7fw-mjwx-w883 vulnerability
issues.author: damiangreen
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

pnpm audit --prod

### Current behavior

qs vulnerability (low) via @mui/x-charts-premium > rasterizehtml > url > qs
GHSA-w7fw-mjwx-w883: qs arrayLimit bypass in comma parsing allows DoS
Vulnerable versions: >=6.7.0 <=6.14.1
Patched: >=6.14.2

**Search keywords**: GHSA-w7fw-mjwx-w883

triage.suggestedAction: Low severity qs DoS vulnerability via rasterizehtml dependency in charts-premium. Update rasterizehtml or override qs.

issues.title: Datagrid, saving a view with reorganize columns, filter and grouping does not work
issues.author: datalogyinc-cloud
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

In a data grid I apply filters, reorganize the columns and grouping. The resulting view I am saving with new name.
When I try to load the saved view it loses all the saved filter, grouping and the column reorganization.

### Your environment

Chrome, Windows 11

**Search keywords**: saving and reloading the view

triage.suggestedAction: Bug report about saved views not persisting filters/grouping/column order. Needs reproduction details and version info. Ask for minimal repro.

issues.title: [DataGrid] Issue on upgrading to latest version
issues.author: Harshit-lawcus
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Steps: current version 8.9.2 upgrade to the latest version

### Current behavior

It's breaking (screenshot provided)

### Expected behavior

It should work

### Context

_No response_

### Your environment

react: 18.3.1, next: 13.5.6, node: v20.17.0, npm: 10.8.2

**Search keywords**: Issue on upgrading to latest version

**Order ID**: 104650

issues.title: [question] Breaking on upgrading version from 8.9.2 to latest version
issues.author: Harshit-lawcus
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

After upgrading from version 8.9.2 to the latest version, the MUI Data Grid component is no longer functioning correctly.

### Your environment

1. react: 18.3.1
2. next: 13.5.6
3. node: v20.17.0

triage.suggestedAction: Duplicate of #21313 by same author. Consider closing as duplicate and consolidating discussion.

issues.title: [pickers] using date-fns adapter with time format KK (Hour [0-11]) does not display properly
issues.author: rvspin
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Link to live example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/6zc5pnrz?file=src%2FDemo.tsx

1. Change the hours in any of the picker.

### Current behavior

The default time is set to 00:32:00 but is showing "KK:32:00 PM" in the field. When changing the hours in the picker, KK is still retained in the field display.

### Expected behavior

Fields should show "00:32:00 PM" as default and get updated when hours are changed in the picker.

### Context

We need to accommodate different date and time formats in the date time picker. We've chosen date-fns as the adapter as it has most of the formats we support, and based on the docs this particular format is supported.

**Search keywords**: time format KK, date-fns adapter

triage.suggestedAction: Bug: date-fns KK format token (Hour 0-11) not recognized by pickers field. Field displays literal 'KK' instead of formatted hour.

issues.title: [Server Side Tree][data grid] Unable to sort the table when the number of rows in the page is less than the number of rows per page
issues.author: thomasmauriceco2ai
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open ServerSideTreeData demo: https://stackblitz.com/edit/vwqxah5w
2. Set rows per page to 50 in the UI
3. Try to sort the table per website or per rating -> the rows don't get sorted

### Current behavior

The rows don't get sorted when the number of rows in the page is less than the number of rows per page.

### Expected behavior

The rows get sorted correctly.

**Search keywords**: ServerSideTree Sorting Datagrid

**Order ID**: 102731

triage.suggestedAction: Bug: server-side tree data sorting fails when actual row count < page size. Investigate pagination/sort interaction in server-side mode.

issues.title: [tree view] lazy-loaded tree: auto-expand child nodes
issues.author: caillou
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

## Question

I am using a lazy-loaded tree.

When loading the child-items, the returned data can already contain their own children. E.g. clicking on `Switzerland` would return a nested sub-tree.

I don't find a way to automatically open all sub-items.

## Motivation

If the sub-tree is nested and only contains a couple of items, we don't want the users to have to click their way to the items.

## What I tried

1. Just doing nothing and hoping for the best.
2. Hacking with controlled `expandedItems`.
3. Using `apiRef`.

See: https://stackblitz.com/edit/wzk8muwu-kzh7bgqk?file=src%2FDemo.tsx

## Related Issue

https://github.com/mui/mui-x/issues/19363

**Search keywords**: tree lazy-load auto-expand

**Order ID**: 110649

triage.suggestedAction: Feature request: auto-expand lazy-loaded child nodes when returned data contains nested children. Related to #19363.

issues.title: [docs] MCP server mui-mcp does not support resource listing
issues.author: f1eeman
issues.body:
### Related page

https://mui.com/material-ui/getting-started/mcp/#vs-code-cursor-windsurf

### Kind of issue

Other

### Issue description

When trying to use MUI X components (e.g., DateField, DateCalendar) in conjunction with MUI MCP server in Windsurf v1.13.9, I encounter the following error:
`Failure listing resources: server mui-mcp does not support resources`

The documentation does not provide guidance on handling MCP server limitations.

### Context

Windsurf v1.13.9

**Search keywords**: MCP, mui-mcp, Failure listing resources, resource listing, x-date-pickers

triage.suggestedAction: Docs feedback: MUI MCP server doesn't support resource listing in Windsurf. Update docs to note MCP server limitations or fix MCP server.

issues.title: [data grid] Screen reader over-reads DOM after rowReordering live region announcement
issues.author: rhysmitchell
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the StackBlitz demo: https://stackblitz.com/edit/vitejs-vite-pf9vrxek
2. Move a row using the row action menu ("Move up"/"Move down")
3. Observe that the live region announces the move, but immediately after, the screen reader dictates the entire grid DOM

### Current behavior

- Row visually moves as expected
- Screen reader announces the move, but followed by the entire DOM of the grid

### Expected behavior

- Row moves trigger clear, concise screen reader announcements
- Works consistently without reading the entire DOM afterwards

### Context

Custom live region implemented as a sibling Box element, visually hidden but with role="status" and aria-live="assertive".

**Search keywords**: MUI, DataGridPro, rowReordering, live region, screen reader, accessibility, aria-live

triage.suggestedAction: Accessibility bug: row reordering live region triggers screen reader to read entire grid DOM. Investigate aria-live region placement and DOM mutation handling.

issues.title: [data grid] Grouping with checkbox selection and server-side-data
issues.author: leonhardanthony
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/b2syssnr?file=src%2FDemo.tsx
2. Use any example with grouping + server side data + checkboxSelection

### Current behavior

1. When a group is selected and then expanded, both the group and its children become deselected.
2. When you select one child in a group, the parent becomes indeterminate. If you close the parent, it loses indeterminate state. Reopening deselects the previously selected row.
3. Can also be reproduced without server-side data with "select all" checkbox.

### Expected behavior

_No response_

**Search keywords**: checkbox selection, grouping, server-side-data

**Order ID**: 118089

triage.suggestedAction: Premium support: multiple checkbox selection bugs with grouping + server-side data. Selection state lost on expand/collapse. Needs investigation of selection state persistence.
